runs.comm: good wheels on the loosener from Dawlat. This buzzed through on a length, outside off, and Chamu left it alone. Hint of away shape

gone second ball! The off stump is leaning like the tower of Pisa, Dawlat is roaring with delight. He aimed a length delivery at the top of off, and Chamu just swished across the line at it. It was a bit of a nothing shot, to be honest. His feet barely moved. Afghanistan strike the first blow!
angled across the left-hander, and just short of a good length. Williams is half forward to push to point.
this has definitely snaked in quite sharply through the air, and Williams isn't quite in the right position, but manages to keep it out.
Williams presents the full face of the bat to punch the ball firmly to extra cover.

Dawlat completes the wicket maiden with a length delivery that shapes in towards the batsman's defensive poke. Impressive start from Afghanistan's quick. That over had pace, bounce and movement to keep probing at the batsmen.
floated down on a full length, and Raza flicks to midwicket.
swinging in once more, and Raza is cramped for room as he takes a step towards leg. Nudged softly into the leg side
finally, Zimbabwe are off the mark. Raza came down the track at this one, which was a slower ball on off stump. He picked it, and flat-batted it just to the left of mid-on for a quick single
Williams unfurls a front-foot cut, but the gap is plugged at cover point and there's no run to be had
fetched from outside off, into the leg side over midwicket. Williams didn't get all of this, but he lifted it over the infield and it had legs to reach the boundary
over mid-off this time! Gulbadin offered up a wide half-volley, and Williams thumped it cleanly over mid off, the ball bouncing once before it passes the rope
this is an odd little stroke from Raza, but it's brought two. Dawlat hit a length on middle, and Raza jumped in the air and flicked it wide of mid-on
Dawlat has been shaping the ball away from the right-hander, but this one has come in off the track to test Raza's defence
play and a miss! Raza walked right across to the off side, and set himself for a huge mow into the leg side. But ball zipped past bat, and for a moment Dawlat also seemed to think he had hit it.
no bat on this one either! Dawlat shows his yorker early today, spearing a quick ball down wide of off. Raza jams his bat down, but the ball has already past him
up and over extra cover! Not a whole lot of movement from his feet, but most importantly the ball has met with the middle of the bat, and it bounces just in front of the boundary
heaved into the leg side this time! It wasn't the best looking shot, the batsman playing right across the line, but he's hit it well and found the gap at deep square leg
digs one in on off stump, and Williams shifts his weight back to pull to deep midwicket.
onto the grass bank! It was a slower ball from Gulbadin, but the batsman was ready and waiting for it, and he sends it over deep midwicket with a thunderclap of a stroke
very full on off stump, and Raza drives to cover
scythed up and over the cover field this time. The shot went in almost exactly the same direction as the last one, but he made sure to clear his left leg and lift the ball over the fielders. Well hit

he's gone this time! This short ball just seems to have taken Raza by surprise a little. His weight was forward, and by the time he got back the ball was already at him, and he spliced a top edge straight up in the air. Gulbadin himself settles under it to hold the catch.
Williams is forward to a length delivery, and chips over mid-on for a couple
Mutumbami has a huge swing at the first ball! He wanted to slog sweep it, but the ball whizzed past the bat and over the stumps. Shahzad fumbles, and they take a bye
reverse sweep! Williams is the only Zimbabwean batsman to play this shot regularly, and he plays it well, beating backward point with a firm stroke that skids along the turf and beats backward point
heaved to the leg side boundary now. Williams just plonked his right foot down the track, and flicked right across it to get the ball behind square on the leg side
three in a row! Williams goes back to the reverse sweep now, and middles it once again. He got down really low, well in advance of the ball's arrival, and smacked it in front of square.
Williams is putting on a show! Now it's back to the orthodox sweep, but he picks it up from outside off and sends it sailing over deep midwicket
just the single this time, though it looked like he wanted more. The ball was fast, flat and short on leg stump, and he pulled it to square leg.
Williams doesn't need a sighter! He comes down the track and slog-sweeps to wide long on, the ball pinging out of the middle.
we're going to need a new ball! Williams has spanked this way, way over deep midwicket with another majestic slog sweep
ah, no bat on this one. Sadiq speared it down full outside off, Williams swept over the top of it.
there's a hint of width outside off, and he runs it down through gully
flicked off the pads, through square leg

down the ground! Williams charged out, but he didn't get anywhere near the pitch of it. He still went through with the stroke, and hit it well - though the long on fielder was interested in the catch. The fielder dived forward at it, but the ball bounced in front of him, and then over him, rolling over the boundary
cut away, but straight to point.
pushed through the gap now, and out to the cover sweeper.
Williams isn't slowing down! He's used the sweep so well, and this is another great example of the stroke, the ball bisecting deep square leg and deep midwicket.
joint fastest T20I fifty by a Zimbabwean Williams backs away to leg, way away, and slaps a quick ball down to long off to go to fifty - from just 21 deliveries!

Mutumbami can also play the slog sweep! He clears his front leg and heaves the ball into the leg side. He's actually hit this well in front of square, and it goes past the midwicket fielder on his left hand side.
slashed down behind point, and they take a quick single.
Mutumbami comes down the track to meet the ball on the full, and drills it down to long-off
chipped nicely straight, though not with a great amount of power. As the long on and long off fielders converge on the ball, the batsmen rush back for the second
Williams misses the reverse sweep for the first time and is struck on the foot by the ball, though well outside off.
an orthodox drive gets the ball to long-off
flicked off the pads, through square leg
Williams is in position and waiting for the paddle sweep as Nabi delivers, getting the ball just to the left of short fine leg.

he's gone! The leggie does the trick! A fine innings comes to an end! Williams was aiming for another boundary. He came down the track at Rashid and biffed him down the ground, but he couldn't get the distance to beat long-off, running around.
a touch too short from Rashid, and Mutumbami hops back into position to crunch a pull into the deep.
oh dear, the leggie has over stepped. He might have had a wicket if he hadn't, Mutumbami having missed his reverse sweep to be struck on the pad. Alas, now he must offer a Free Hit.
the extra ball is slogged high out towards deep midwicket, plugging on the outfield between the fielders, and they rush back for the second.
cracked out into the leg side again, but he finds the fielder in the deep.
leading edge! The bowler shouted "catch!" as this looped in the air, but it fell safely past cover. Chigumbura was aiming leg side, but the spin took the leading edge.
a top-edged sweep balloons over the keeper's head, and comes safely down to earth before short fine leg can get around
Mutumbami is down the track, and powers a drive to long-off
speared in at middle and off, from around the wicket, and Chigumbura is forward to defend
slapped in the air, but falling well short of long-off.
the ball lands on middle stump, and the angle from around the wicket means that the batsman can easily work it into the leg side. They rush back for a second
Mutumbami goes back and across and cracks the ball very hard into the covers. The fielder gets down to it, and does well to half stop it, but it's clearly stung his hand
pushed back to the bowler, who fields in his followthrough
Mutumbami comes down the wicket, and he's not to the pitch of it and has to thrust his bat out at the wide ball. He manages to get it down through gully
Chigumbura lofts his drive over the covers, and the sweeper comes around to keep them to two
pushed back to the bowler, who bends low to stop it

in the air ... and short of long on! Chigumbura is not timing the ball as he'd like to, but that has actually saved him. He hit this so badly that the long on fielder couldn't get in quickly enough to catch it
but Mutumbami is middling them! He's collected six more with a big slog sweep. The ball sent the schoolkids in the stands running for cover!
a flashing shot outside off, but the ball goes past the outside edge of the bat.
top edged! Chigumbura slogs across the line, and it loops up and falls just short of a diving fielder at short third man.
another big heave, and again he misses. This time it comes off the pad and they take a leg bye.
driven down the ground to long-off.
Nabi has dug this in too short, and it's pulled to deep square leg.
very full, right at his toes, and it's dug out past midwicket.
flicked into the leg side, with the spin.
this is a little too short outside off, and the spin away from the bat takes it further. Cut in front of point.
Chigumbura waits on the back foot to punch through extra cover, finding the fielder at cover sweeper
the batsman flashes a drive outside off, but the ball dips on him and spins away to beat the edge

nailed it! Mutumbami is striking these slog sweeps really well. He's picked it up from outside off, and once again hit it onto the stand beyond deep midwicket, where there's a group of schoolkids seated. None of them are brave enough to attempt a catch!
pushed through much quicker, and he forces to long off
edged! But it's brought runs, which is vital. Chigumbura wanted to cut this square, but the ball leapt up at him, and the edge beats third man
Mutumbami comes down the track, but he's nowhere near the ball and it's toe ended back to the bowler.
arrowed down the leg side, Mutumbami misses his sweep and and the umpire calls wide.
play and a miss outside off! The batsman wanted to dab it late, but waited a little too long.
lapped down quite fine, just to the right of the short fine leg fielder.
ouch! Chigumbura hit this in the air down the ground, and Nabi stuck his left hand out at it. It flicked the fingers, painfully it seems, and is stopped by long-on.
nudged off the hip area, and through the gap at square leg

powerful hit down the ground! The first one he's really middled. The ball was a full toss, so it was there to be hit. The ball swerved in the air, as he undercut it slightly in the shot, to evade the long-on fielder.
slapped out through extra cover, to the sweeper
sharp single! Mutumbami placed it in front of square, and they took off. The throw went to Hamza, but the batsman was safe.
swiped across the line, and down to long-on.
nicely placed by Richmond. The ball was very full, and quite wide, and he laced it right between the long-off and sweeper cover fielders.

oh, that's a timely strike. An enterprising knock comes to an end. Mutumbami has placed the orthodox sweep much better than the reverse, which has now lead to his dismissal. He swaps himself around in the crease, but the ball is much too full and he can't get his reverse sweep down in time. Pinged in front of middle.
flicked off the pads, but straight to the man at short fine leg.
ah, this is much too short from the offie. He came round the wicket and delivered a long hop on leg stump, Chigumbura pulling it away behind square
the batsman gets across to off and plays a big slog sweep, but the ball rushes past him and over the stumps
appeal for caught behind! The ball was pushed through flat and fast outside off, and fizzed past his cut. The Umpire says he's not out
paddled very fine indeed down to fine leg.
swiped out into the leg side, square of the wicket. The fielders converge on it to keep them to two.
another appeal for caught behind! Again Chigumbura is on the cut, but he misses the stroke. Not given.
and almost gets him again! Ervine pokes at a rising delivery outside off stump and the edge flies past a diving Mohammad Shahzad, bouncing down to the boundary.

he has his man! Caught in the deep! Dawlat sent down another length delivery, but this time Ervine was on the walk into the leg side. He scooped the ball high into the air, but not far enough to beat the fielder.
definite movement in through the air for Afghanistan's quick. Chigumbura went neither forward nor back, and the ball beat his inside edge.
this time the movement slants the ball in towards his pads, and Chigumbura picks up two with a flick to square leg
he's down the track to get to this on the full, and swipes to wide long-on
Waller is off the mark straight away, tapping the ball down in front of point.
chipped down the ground, but falling well short of long-off.
Chigumbura swings hard to leg, but the ball is bottom edged to short fine leg for a quick single. For a man with a career strike rate of 152, this innings is not his best advertisement.
a very full ball is squeezed out through gully.
down the track, and huge swing of the bat, but the ball goes on with the arm from around the wicket and hits him on the thigh. It ricochets to third man, and they take one.
Waller backs away to leg and drives to the left of extra cover.
Chigumbura comes down the track and targets long-on with a slog, but he's not hit it all that well and the fielder down there holds an easy catch.
there's the yorker from Dawlat. It's too good for Madziva, zipping under his bat, but it's outside off stump.
Waller spots this slower ball early, and clears his front leg to swat it over wide long on with a flat-batted slog. It lands in the practice nets. Huge hit!

but gone this time! It was another slower one, out of the back of the hand by the looks of things, and this time Waller has aimed over long off. But he didn't connect it well enough to beat the fielder, who caught it about a foot in from the rope.
big full toss outside off! In fact that's a no ball. It was really high, and Madziva sliced it over point from about chest height
they'll take the runs any way they can get them! Masakadza heaves, and the inside edge flies down very fine to the fine leg boundary.
